#summary Specification for Handle

== Handle Specification ==

There are two sources for the Handle specs: 

  * [http://hdl.handle.net/4263537/4068 RFC 3651] (Nov. '03)
  * [http://handle.net/download.html HANDLE.NET 6.2] (Sep. '07)

Additionally the Handle System type registry (`0.TYPE`) has a number of registered types which may be used in the codebase and not referenced in the RFC, and vice versa.

The RFC is authoritative but has slipped somewhat with respect to the HANDLE.NET 6.2 Java codebase. The table below attempts to capture some of the disparity between the RFC and the codebase.

|| *RFC Section* || *Leave* || *Remove* || *Add* || *Reference* || *Comment* ||

|| [http://www.apps.ietf.org/rfc/rfc3651.html#sec-3.1 Sect. 3.1], p. 7 || - || `ADMIN_EXECUTE` || - || [http://www.handle.net/mail-archive/handle-info/msg00237.html SR] || Feature placeholder - unimplemented ||
|| [http://www.apps.ietf.org/rfc/rfc3651.html#sec-3.2.1 Sect. 3.2.1], p. 13 || - || `LIST_NA` || - || [http://www.handle.net/mail-archive/handle-info/msg00237.html SR] || Already set in the server configuration file ||
